Spoiled Apricorn.effect: An Apricorn that's had its insides eaten. Hitting a Pokémon with one may stun the Pokémon, creating an opening for you to act.

Squall Slate.name: Squall Slate
Squall Slate.effect: A slate overflowing with enigmatic energy. You can feel a strong connection between it and the Squall Room at Ramanas Park.

Stable Mulch.name: Stable Mulch
Stable Mulch.effect: A fertilizer for growing Berries. However, it appears to be unsuitable for the soil in the Hoenn region and has no effect.

Star Piece.name: Star Piece
Star Piece.effect: A small shard of a beautiful gem that gives off a distinctly red sparkle. It can be sold at a high price to shops.

Stardust.name: Stardust
Stardust.effect: Lovely red sand that flows between the fingers with a loose, silky feel. It can be sold at a low price to shops.

Stealth Spray.name: Stealth Spray
Stealth Spray.effect: When used in the field, this spray muffles the sound of your footsteps and makes wild Pokémon less likely to notice you for a short time.

Steel Tera Shard.name: Steel Tera Shard
Steel Tera Shard.effect: On rare occasions, these shards form when a Tera Pokémon falls in battle and its Tera Jewel shatters.

Sticky Glob.name: Sticky Glob
Sticky Glob.effect: A ball of some kind of sticky substance. Hitting a Pokémon with one may stun the Pokémon, creating an opening for you to act.

Strange Souvenir.name: Strange Souvenir
Strange Souvenir.effect: An ornament depicting a mysterious Pokémon that has been venerated as a guardian deity for an extremely long time in the Alola region.

Stratospheric Slate.name: Stratospheric Slate
Stratospheric Slate.effect: A slate overflowing with enigmatic energy. You can feel a strong connection between it and the Stratospheric Room at Ramanas Park.

Stretchy Spring.name: Stretchy Spring
Stretchy Spring.effect: A thin small spring. It's totally stretched out, and what it's used for is unknown.

Super Lure.name: Super Lure
Super Lure.effect: A bottle of perfume that makes rare Pokémon more likely to appear when sprayed about. Its effect lasts longer than that of a Lure.

Super Repel.name: Super Repel
Super Repel.effect: An item that prevents low-level wild Pokémon from jumping out at you for a time. It lasts longer than Repel.

Surprise Mulch.name: Surprise Mulch
Surprise Mulch.effect: A fertilizer for growing Berries. However, it appears to be unsuitable for the soil in the Hoenn region and has no effect.

Survival Charm.name: Survival Charm
Survival Charm.effect: A mysterious charm that holds the power to protect a person from fainting while out in the field. This type of charm comes in five different colors.

Tectonic Slate.name: Tectonic Slate
Tectonic Slate.effect: A slate overflowing with enigmatic energy. You can feel a strong connection between it and the Tectonic Room at Ramanas Park.

Tempting Charm.name: Tempting Charm
Tempting Charm.effect: A mysterious charm that tends to be lost before any other item when you faint in the field. This type of charm comes in five different colors.

Tiny Bamboo Shoot.name: Tiny Bamboo Shoot
Tiny Bamboo Shoot.effect: A small and rare bamboo shoot. It's quite popular with a certain class of gourmands.

Tiny Mushroom.name: Tiny Mushroom
Tiny Mushroom.effect: A small and rare mushroom. It's quite popular with a certain class of collectors.

Tropical Shell.name: Tropical Shell
Tropical Shell.effect: A beautiful white shell that may have drifted from a sea in a warm region.

Warding Charm.name: Warding Charm
Warding Charm.effect: A mysterious charm that holds the power to protect a person from being afflicted with status conditions. This type of charm comes in five different colors.

Water Tera Shard.name: Water Tera Shard
Water Tera Shard.effect: On rare occasions, these shards form when a Tera Pokémon falls in battle and its Tera Jewel shatters.

White Apricorn.name: White Apricorn
White Apricorn.effect: A white Apricorn. It doesn't have any aroma at all.

White Flute.name: White Flute
White Flute.effect: A flute made from white glass. It makes it easier to encounter low-level Pokémon in the place you use it.

Wishing Chip.name: Wishing Chip
Wishing Chip.effect: Toss a number of them into a Pokémon Den for the chance to attract a wild Dynamax Pokémon.

Yellow Apricorn.name: Yellow Apricorn
Yellow Apricorn.effect: A yellow Apricorn. It has a light, refreshing scent.

Yellow Flute.name: Yellow Flute
Yellow Flute.effect: A flute made from yellow glass. It snaps Pokémon out of confusion.

Yellow Nectar.name: Yellow Nectar
Yellow Nectar.effect: Flower nectar obtained from a yellow flower. It changes the form of a certain species of Pokémon.

Yellow Shard.name: Yellow Shard
Yellow Shard.effect: A small yellow shard. It appears to be a fragment of some sort of implement made long ago.

Ability Shield.name: Ability Shield

Absorb Bulb.name: Absorb Bulb
Absorb Bulb.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This single-use bulb boosts the Sp. Atk stat if the holder is damaged by a Water-type attack.

Binding Band.name: Binding Band

Black Belt.name: Black Belt

Black Glasses.name: Black Glasses

Black Sludge.name: Black Sludge

Blue Scarf.name: Blue Scarf

Blunder Policy.name: Blunder Policy

Bright Powder.name: Bright Powder

Bug Gem.name: Bug Gem

Bug Memory.name: Bug Memory
Bug Memory.effect: A memory disc that contains Bug-type data. It changes the type of the holder if held by a certain species of Pokémon.

Buginium Z.name: Buginium Z
Buginium Z.effect: It converts Z-Power into crystals that upgrade Bug-type moves to Bug-type Z-Moves.

Burn Drive.name: Burn Drive

Cell Battery.name: Cell Battery

Charcoal.name: Charcoal

Chill Drive.name: Chill Drive

Choice Band.name: Choice Band

Choice Scarf.name: Choice Scarf

Choice Specs.name: Choice Specs

Cleanse Tag.name: Cleanse Tag

Damp Rock.name: Damp Rock

Dark Gem.name: Dark Gem

Darkinium Z.effect: It converts Z-Power into crystals that upgrade Dark-type moves to Dark-type Z-Moves.

Decidium Z.effect: It converts Z-Power into crystals that upgrade Decidueye's Spirit Shackle to a Z-Move.

Douse Drive.effect: A cassette to be held by Genesect. It changes Genesect's Techno Blast move so it becomes Water type.

Firium Z.effect: It converts Z-Power into crystals that upgrade Fire-type moves to Fire-type Z-Moves.

Fist Plate.name: Fist Plate

Flame Orb.name: Flame Orb

Green Scarf.effect: When a Pokémon holds this during a contest, it looks even cleverer than usual.

Iron Plate.name: Iron Plate

Odd Incense.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This incense has a curious aroma that boosts the power of the holder's Psychic-type moves.

Pikanium Z.name: Pikanium Z
Pikanium Z.effect: It converts Z-Power into crystals that upgrade Pikachu's Volt Tackle to a Z-Move.

Pikashunium Z.name: Pikashunium Z
Pikashunium Z.effect: This is a crystallized form of Z-Power. It upgrades Thunderbolt to a Z-Move when used by a Pikachu wearing a cap.

Pink Scarf.name: Pink Scarf
Pink Scarf.effect: When a Pokémon holds this during a contest, it looks even cuter than usual.

Pixie Plate.name: Pixie Plate
Pixie Plate.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This stone tablet is imbued with the essence of fairies and boosts the power of the holder's Fairy-type moves.

Poison Barb.name: Poison Barb
Poison Barb.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This small poisonous barb boosts the power of the holder's Poison-type moves.

Poison Gem.name: Poison Gem
Poison Gem.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This gem is imbued with the essence of poison and will boost the power of a Poison-type move—but only once.

Poison Memory.name: Poison Memory
Poison Memory.effect: A memory disc that contains Poison-type data. It changes the type of the holder if held by a certain species of Pokémon.

Poisonium Z.name: Poisonium Z
Poisonium Z.effect: It converts Z-Power into crystals that upgrade Poison-type moves to Poison-type Z-Moves.

Power Anklet.name: Power Anklet
Power Anklet.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. Holding this anklet reduces a Pokémon's Speed in battle but allows its Speed stat to grow more quickly.

Power Band.name: Power Band
Power Band.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. Holding this band reduces a Pokémon's Speed in battle but allows its Sp. Def stat to grow more quickly.

Power Belt.name: Power Belt
Power Belt.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. Holding this belt reduces a Pokémon's Speed in battle but allows its Defense stat to grow more quickly.

Power Bracer.name: Power Bracer
Power Bracer.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. Holding this bracer reduces a Pokémon's Speed in battle but allows its Attack stat to grow more quickly.

Power Herb.name: Power Herb
Power Herb.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It allows the holder to immediately use a move that normally requires a turn to charge—but only once.

Power Lens.name: Power Lens
Power Lens.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. Holding this lens reduces a Pokémon's Speed in battle but allows its Sp. Atk stat to grow more quickly.

Power Weight.name: Power Weight
Power Weight.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. Holding this weight reduces a Pokémon's Speed in battle but allows its HP stat to grow more quickly.

Primarium Z.name: Primarium Z
Primarium Z.effect: It converts Z-Power into crystals that upgrade Primarina's Sparkling Aria to a Z-Move.

Protective Pads.name: Protective Pads
Protective Pads.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. These pads protect the holder from effects triggered by making direct contact with another Pokémon.

Psychic Gem.name: Psychic Gem
Psychic Gem.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This gem is imbued with the essence of psychic energy and will boost the power of a Psychic-type move—but only once.

Psychic Memory.name: Psychic Memory
Psychic Memory.effect: A memory disc that contains Psychic-type data. It changes the type of the holder if held by a certain species of Pokémon.

Psychic Seed.name: Psychic Seed
Psychic Seed.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. If the terrain becomes Psychic Terrain, the holder will use this seed to boost its own Sp. Def stat.

Psychium Z.name: Psychium Z
Psychium Z.effect: It converts Z-Power into crystals that upgrade Psychic-type moves to Psychic-type Z-Moves.

Punching Glove.name: Punching Glove
Punching Glove.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This protective glove boosts the power of the holder's punching moves and prevents direct contact with targets.

Pure Incense.name: Pure Incense
Pure Incense.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It helps keep wild Pokémon away when the holder is the head of the party.

Quick Claw.name: Quick Claw
Quick Claw.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This light, sharp claw lets the holder move first occasionally.

Quick Powder.name: Quick Powder
Quick Powder.effect: An item to be held by Ditto. Extremely fine yet hard, this odd powder boosts Ditto's Speed stat.

Red Card.name: Red Card
Red Card.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. If the holder is damaged by an attack, the mysterious power of this card can remove the attacker from the battle.

Red Orb.name: Red Orb
Red Orb.effect: A shiny red orb that is said to have a deep connection to a legend of the Hoenn region.

Red Scarf.name: Red Scarf
Red Scarf.effect: When a Pokémon holds this during a contest, it looks even cooler than usual.

Ring Target.name: Ring Target
Ring Target.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. Moves that would normally have no effect due to type matchups will still hit the holder.

Rock Gem.name: Rock Gem
Rock Gem.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This gem is imbued with the essence of rock and will boost the power of a Rock-type move—but only once.

Rock Incense.name: Rock Incense
Rock Incense.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This incense has a curious aroma that boosts the power of the holder's Rock-type moves.

Rock Memory.name: Rock Memory
Rock Memory.effect: A memory disc that contains Rock-type data. It changes the type of the holder if held by a certain species of Pokémon.

Rockium Z.name: Rockium Z
Rockium Z.effect: It converts Z-Power into crystals that upgrade Rock-type moves to Rock-type Z-Moves.

Rocky Helmet.name: Rocky Helmet
Rocky Helmet.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. If another Pokémon makes direct contact with the holder, that Pokémon will be damaged.

Room Service.name: Room Service
Room Service.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. If Trick Room takes effect, this item will lower the holder's Speed stat.

Rose Incense.name: Rose Incense
Rose Incense.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This incense has a curious aroma that boosts the power of the holder's Grass-type moves.

Rusted Shield.name: Rusted Shield
Rusted Shield.effect: It is said that a hero used this shield to halt a terrible disaster in ancient times. But it's grown rusty and worn.

Rusted Sword.name: Rusted Sword
Rusted Sword.effect: It is said that a hero used this sword to halt a terrible disaster in ancient times. But it's grown rusty and worn.

Safety Goggles.name: Safety Goggles
Safety Goggles.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. These goggles protect the holder from both sandstorm damage and the effects of powders and spores.

Scope Lens.name: Scope Lens
Scope Lens.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It's a lens for scoping out weak points. It boosts the holder's critical-hit ratio.

Sea Incense.name: Sea Incense
Sea Incense.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This incense has a curious aroma that boosts the power of the holder's Water-type moves.

Sharp Beak.name: Sharp Beak
Sharp Beak.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It's a long, sharp beak that boosts the power of the holder's Flying-type moves.

Shed Shell.name: Shed Shell
Shed Shell.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. Hard and sturdy, this discarded carapace enables the holder to switch out of battle without fail.

Shell Bell.name: Shell Bell
Shell Bell.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. The holder restores a little HP to itself every time it inflicts damage with an attack.

Shock Drive.name: Shock Drive
Shock Drive.effect: A cassette to be held by Genesect. It changes Genesect's Techno Blast move so it becomes Electric type.

Silk Scarf.name: Silk Scarf
Silk Scarf.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It's a sumptuous scarf that boosts the power of the holder's Normal-type moves.

Silver Powder.name: Silver Powder
Silver Powder.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It's a shiny silver powder that boosts the power of the holder's Bug-type moves.

Sky Plate.name: Sky Plate
Sky Plate.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This stone tablet is imbued with the essence of flight and boosts the power of the holder's Flying-type moves.

Smoke Ball.name: Smoke Ball
Smoke Ball.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It enables the holder to flee from any wild Pokémon encounter without fail.

Smooth Rock.name: Smooth Rock
Smooth Rock.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. When the holder changes the weather to a sandstorm, the storm will persist for longer than usual.

Snorlium Z.name: Snorlium Z
Snorlium Z.effect: It converts Z-Power into crystals that upgrade Snorlax's Giga Impact to a Z-Move.

Soft Sand.name: Soft Sand
Soft Sand.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It's a loose, silky sand that boosts the power of the holder's Ground-type moves.

Solganium Z.name: Solganium Z
Solganium Z.effect: It converts Z-Power into crystals that upgrade Solgaleo's Sunsteel Strike to a Z-Move.

Soothe Bell.name: Soothe Bell
Soothe Bell.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. The comforting chime of this bell calms the holder, making it friendly.

Soul Dew.name: Soul Dew
Soul Dew.effect: A wondrous orb to be held by Latios or Latias. It boosts the power of their Psychic- and Dragon-type moves.

Spell Tag.name: Spell Tag
Spell Tag.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It's a sinister, eerie tag that boosts the power of the holder's Ghost-type moves.

Splash Plate.name: Splash Plate
Splash Plate.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This stone tablet is imbued with the essence of water and boosts the power of the holder's Water-type moves.

Spooky Plate.name: Spooky Plate
Spooky Plate.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This stone tablet is imbued with the essence of ghosts and boosts the power of the holder's Ghost-type moves.

Steel Gem.name: Steel Gem
Steel Gem.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This gem is imbued with the essence of steel and will boost the power of a Steel-type move—but only once.

Steel Memory.name: Steel Memory
Steel Memory.effect: A memory disc that contains Steel-type data. It changes the type of the holder if held by a certain species of Pokémon.

Steelium Z.name: Steelium Z
Steelium Z.effect: It converts Z-Power into crystals that upgrade Steel-type moves to Steel-type Z-Moves.

Sticky Barb.name: Sticky Barb
Sticky Barb.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It damages the holder every turn and may latch on to Pokémon that make direct contact with the holder.

Stone Plate.name: Stone Plate
Stone Plate.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This stone tablet is imbued with the essence of rock and boosts the power of the holder's Rock-type moves.

Tapunium Z.name: Tapunium Z
Tapunium Z.effect: It converts Z-Power into crystals that upgrade the tapu's Nature's Madness to a Z-Move.

Terrain Extender.name: Terrain Extender
Terrain Extender.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It extends the duration of terrain caused by the holder's move or Ability.

Thick Club.name: Thick Club
Thick Club.effect: An item to be held by Cubone or Marowak. This hard bone of unknown origin boosts their Attack stat.

Throat Spray.name: Throat Spray
Throat Spray.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. If the holder uses a sound-based move, this throat spray will boost its Sp. Atk stat.

Toxic Orb.name: Toxic Orb
Toxic Orb.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It's a bizarre orb that exudes toxins when touched and will badly poison the holder during battle.

Toxic Plate.name: Toxic Plate
Toxic Plate.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This stone tablet is imbued with the essence of poison and boosts the power of the holder's Poison-type moves.

Twisted Spoon.name: Twisted Spoon
Twisted Spoon.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This spoon is imbued with telekinetic energy and boosts the power of the holder's Psychic-type moves.

Ultranecrozium Z.name: Ultranecrozium Z
Ultranecrozium Z.effect: It's a crystal that turns Necrozma fused with Solgaleo or Lunala into a new form.

Utility Umbrella.name: Utility Umbrella
Utility Umbrella.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This sturdy umbrella protects the holder from the effects of rain and harsh sunlight.

Water Gem.name: Water Gem
Water Gem.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This gem is imbued with the essence of water and will boost the power of a Water-type move—but only once.

Water Memory.name: Water Memory
Water Memory.effect: A memory disc that contains Water-type data. It changes the type of the holder if held by a certain species of Pokémon.

Waterium Z.name: Waterium Z
Waterium Z.effect: It converts Z-Power into crystals that upgrade Water-type moves to Water-type Z-Moves.

Wave Incense.name: Wave Incense
Wave Incense.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This incense has a curious aroma that boosts the power of the holder's Water-type moves.

Weakness Policy.name: Weakness Policy
Weakness Policy.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. If the holder is hit with a move it's weak to, this policy sharply boosts its Attack and Sp. Atk stats.

Wellspring Mask.name: Wellspring Mask
Wellspring Mask.effect: An item to be held by Ogerpon. This carved wooden mask is adorned with crystals and allows Ogerpon to wield the Water type during battle.

White Herb.name: White Herb
White Herb.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It will restore any lowered stat in battle—but only once.

Wide Lens.name: Wide Lens
Wide Lens.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It's a magnifying lens that slightly boosts the accuracy of the holder's moves.

Wise Glasses.name: Wise Glasses
Wise Glasses.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This thick pair of glasses slightly boosts the power of the holder's special moves.

Yellow Scarf.name: Yellow Scarf
Yellow Scarf.effect: When a Pokémon holds this during a contest, it looks even tougher than usual.

Zap Plate.name: Zap Plate
Zap Plate.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This stone tablet is imbued with the essence of electricity and boosts the power of the holder's Electric-type moves.

Zoom Lens.name: Zoom Lens
Zoom Lens.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. When the holder acts after its target, its move will be more accurate than usual.

Acro Bike.name: Acro Bike
Acro Bike.effect: The key to New Mauville, which was constructed beneath Mauville City.

Adventure Guide.name: Adventure Guide
Adventure Guide.effect: A mysterious and convenient notebook that contains all the advice a Trainer receives out on an adventure.

Apricorn Box.name: Apricorn Box
Apricorn Box.effect: A handy box where you can store up to 99 of each kind of Apricorn.

Aqua Suit.name: Aqua Suit
Aqua Suit.effect: A suit made with the collective technological know-how of Team Aqua. It can withstand any impact.

Armor Pass.name: Armor Pass
Armor Pass.effect: A pass to go to the Isle of Armor. Show it to the rail staff at Wedgehurst Station.

Autograph.name: Autograph
Autograph.effect: The autograph you got from the Vermilion City Gym Leader, Lt. Surge. He wrote, “Good luck!”

Azelf's Fang.name: Azelf's Fang
Azelf's Fang.effect: Proof that you have completed the trial set by Azelf, the Being of Willpower that lives in Lake Valor. This item is needed to forge the Red Chain.

Band Autograph.name: Band Autograph
Band Autograph.effect: It's signed by all members of the Galar region's most charismatic band, the Maximizers.

Basement Key.name: Basement Key
Basement Key.effect: A key that opens a door in the Goldenrod Tunnel.

Berry Pots.name: Berry Pots
Berry Pots.effect: Portable containers that allow you to easily cultivate Berries anywhere and anytime.

Bicycle.name: Bicycle
Bicycle.effect: A folding bike that enables a rider to get around much faster than with Running Shoes.

Black Mane Hair.name: Black Mane Hair
Black Mane Hair.effect: Mane hair that belonged to the King of Bountiful Harvests' beloved steed, Spectrier. The hair is very smooth to the touch.

Blank Plate.name: Blank Plate
Blank Plate.effect: A stone tablet imbued with the essence of normalcy. When used on a certain Pokémon, it allows that Pokémon to gain the power of the Normal type.

Blue Card.name: Blue Card
Blue Card.effect: A card to save points for the Buena's Password show.

Blue Petal.name: Blue Petal
Blue Petal.effect: A pressed flower petal you receive from Lana during Mina's trial. The goal is to collect seven different kinds of petals.

Camping Gear.name: Camping Gear
Camping Gear.effect: Everything you need to set up a tent and get cooking in a Wild Area or at a camping spot.

Card Key.name: Card Key
Card Key.effect: A card key that opens a shutter in the Radio Tower.

Carrot Seeds.name: Carrot Seeds
Carrot Seeds.effect: Seeds to plant in a field. The kind of carrot you'll get is determined by which field you plant the seeds in.

Catching Charm.name: Catching Charm
Catching Charm.effect: Having one of these mysterious, unshakable charms makes it more likely you'll get a critical catch.

Celestica Flute.name: Celestica Flute
Celestica Flute.effect: A flute that can be used to call special Pokémon that are willing to bear you around the region. Its timbre is eerie and mysterious.

Clear Bell.name: Clear Bell
Clear Bell.effect: A very old-fashioned bell that makes a gentle ringing sound.

Coin Case.name: Coin Case
Coin Case.effect: A case for holding coins obtained at the Game Corner. It can hold up to 50,000 coins.

Colress Machine.name: Colress Machine
Colress Machine.effect: This item, when given to you by Colress, will allow for you to remove Pokémon from blocking your path.

Contest Costume.name: Contest Costume
Contest Costume.effect: A very cool suit to be worn during the Contest Spectacular.

Contest Pass.name: Contest Pass
Contest Pass.effect: A pass required for entering Pokémon Contests. It has a drawing of an award ribbon on its front.

Coupon 1.name: Coupon 1
Coupon 1.effect: A coupon to be exchanged for a Pokémon Watch— Pokétch for short. Three coupons are needed.

Coupon 2.name: Coupon 2
Coupon 2.effect: A coupon to be exchanged for a Pokémon Watch— Pokétch for short. Three coupons are needed.

Coupon 3.name: Coupon 3
Coupon 3.effect: A coupon to be exchanged for a Pokémon Watch— Pokétch for short. Three coupons are needed.

Crafting Kit.name: Crafting Kit
Crafting Kit.effect: A kit containing everything you might need for crafting, even when there is no workbench around. However, you can only use the materials you have in your satchel.

Crown Pass.name: Crown Pass
Crown Pass.effect: A pass to go to the Crown Tundra. Show it to the rail staff at Wedgehurst Station.

Crystal Cluster.name: Crystal Cluster
Crystal Cluster.effect: A cluster of the crystals found within the Crystal Pool. They sparkle brilliantly and are apparently necessary to repair a certain mask.

DNA Splicers.name: DNA Splicers
DNA Splicers.effect: A splicer that fuses Kyurem and a certain Pokémon. They are said to have originally been one.

DS Sounds.name: DS Sounds
DS Sounds.effect: A music player that allows you to listen to nostalgic songs. It's operated with the flip of a single switch.

Dark Stone.name: Dark Stone
Dark Stone.effect: Zekrom's body was destroyed and changed into this stone. It is said to be waiting for the emergence of a hero.

Devon Goods.name: Devon Goods
Devon Goods.effect: A package that contains DEVON's machine parts.

Devon Parts.name: Devon Parts
Devon Parts.effect: A case that contains mechanical parts of some sort made by the Devon Corporation.

Devon Scope.name: Devon Scope
Devon Scope.effect: A special device made by Devon Corporation that signals the presence of any unseen Pokémon.

Devon Scuba Gear.name: Devon Scuba Gear
Devon Scuba Gear.effect: A device made by Devon Corporation that provides oxygen to users during the use of Dive.

Digger Drill.name: Digger Drill
Digger Drill.effect: A single-use drill to bore a hole in the wall for your Secret Base.

Dowsing Machine.name: Dowsing Machine
Dowsing Machine.effect: This high-tech machine shows the location of invisible items. It's attached to the head when in use.

Dragon Skull.name: Dragon Skull
Dragon Skull.effect: The skull of a Pokémon that was said to have braved the raging seas to fly around the world.

Dropped Item.name: Dropped Item
Dropped Item.effect: The Xtransceiver found at the Nimbasa City amusement park. It seems it belongs to a boy.

Dynamax Band.name: Dynamax Band
Dynamax Band.effect: A Wishing Star has been affixed to it. It lets out a light that allows Pokémon to Dynamax when at a Power Spot.

Elevator Key.name: Elevator Key
Elevator Key.effect: A card key that activates the elevator in Lysandre Labs. It is emblazoned with Team Flare's logo.

Endorsement.name: Endorsement
Endorsement.effect: A letter of recommendation that you'll need in order to participate in the Gym Challenge.

Enigmatic Card.name: Enigmatic Card
Enigmatic Card.effect: A mysterious card. Written on it is a request that you go to a guest room in the motel on Akala Island's Route 8.

Eon Flute.name: Eon Flute
Eon Flute.effect: A flute that can be used to summon Latios or Latias no matter where you are.

Eternal Ice.name: Eternal Ice
Eternal Ice.effect: A type of ice beloved by the Lord of the Tundra, Avalugg. This ice is said to be fragments of ancient Avalugg that lived long ago.

Exp. Charm.name: Exp. Charm
Exp. Charm.effect: Having one of these charms increases the Exp. Points your Pokémon get. A machine-like object is inside it.

Explorer Kit.name: Explorer Kit
Explorer Kit.effect: A bag filled with convenient tools for exploring. It provides access to the Underground in the Sinnoh region.

Fashion Case.name: Fashion Case
Fashion Case.effect: A wondrous, pretty case to store lots of colorful Props for your Pokémon to wear in a musical.

Fishing Rod.name: Fishing Rod
Fishing Rod.effect: Use it by the water to fish up various kinds of Pokémon.

Forage Bag.name: Forage Bag
Forage Bag.effect: A bag to carry ingredients gathered during Mallow's trial in the jungle.

GB Sounds.name: GB Sounds
GB Sounds.effect: A music player that allows you to listen to nostalgic songs. It's operated with the flip of a single switch.

Galactic Key.name: Galactic Key
Galactic Key.effect: A card key for disengaging the security systems in the Galactic HQ. Losing it can result in punishment, apparently.

Glimmering Charm.name: Glimmering Charm
Glimmering Charm.effect: Having one of these mysterious glimmering charms increases the number of Tera Shards you receive from Tera Raid Battles.

Go-Goggles.name: Go-Goggles
Go-Goggles.effect: Nifty goggles to protect eyes from desert sandstorms.

Gold Teeth.name: Gold Teeth
Gold Teeth.effect: A set of false teeth lost by the SAFARI ZONE'S WARDEN. It makes his smile sparkle.

Good Rod.name: Good Rod
Good Rod.effect: A new, good-quality fishing rod. Use it at bodies of water to fish for Pokémon.

Gracidea.name: Gracidea
Gracidea.effect: A flower sometimes bundled into a bouquet to be given as an expression of gratitude on special occasions, such as birthdays and anniversaries.

Gram 1.name: Gram 1
Gram 1.effect: An important letter that Wingull delivers.

Gram 2.name: Gram 2
Gram 2.effect: An important letter that Wingull delivers.

Gram 3.name: Gram 3
Gram 3.effect: An important letter that Wingull delivers.

Green Petal.name: Green Petal
Green Petal.effect: A pressed flower petal you receive from Mallow during Mina's trial. The goal is to collect seven different kinds of petals.

Grubby Hanky.name: Grubby Hanky
Grubby Hanky.effect: A handkerchief dropped by a regular at Nacrene City's Café Warehouse. It smells faintly like a Pokémon.

Hi-tech Earbuds.name: Hi-tech Earbuds
Hi-tech Earbuds.effect: Strange earbuds that allow you to freely control the volume of various sounds.

Holo Caster.name: Holo Caster
Holo Caster.effect: A device that allows you to view the hologram clips you have received at any time.

Honor of Kalos.name: Honor of Kalos
Honor of Kalos.effect: A precious symbol that is awarded to individuals who have done great things for the Kalos region.

Iceroot Carrot.name: Iceroot Carrot
Iceroot Carrot.effect: Produce that the King of Bountiful Harvests' beloved steed likes to eat. It grew in a field covered in snow.

Ilima's Normalium Z.name: Ilima's Normalium Z
Ilima's Normalium Z.effect: The Normalium Z you were entrusted with by Ilima. You were asked to place it on the pedestal at the back of Verdant Cavern.

Indigo Style Card.name: Indigo Style Card
Indigo Style Card.effect: Having one of these cards increases the selection available to you in boutiques and hair salons.

Intriguing Stone.name: Intriguing Stone
Intriguing Stone.effect: A rather curious stone that might appear valuable to some. It's all in the eye of the beholder.

Jade Orb.name: Jade Orb
Jade Orb.effect: A shiny green orb that is said to have a deep connection to a legend of the Hoenn region.

Journal.name: Journal
Journal.effect: A notebook that keeps a record of your adventure so far.

Key Stone.name: Key Stone
Key Stone.effect: A stone filled with an unexplained power. It makes Pokémon that battle with a Mega Stone Mega Evolve.

Mega Stone.name: Mega Stone
Mega Stone.effect: If activated with a Key Stone, causes a specific Pokémon to undergo Mega Evolution.

Key to Room 1.name: Key to Room 1
Key to Room 1.effect: A key that opens a door inside Sea Mauville.

Key to Room 2.name: Key to Room 2
Key to Room 2.effect: A key that opens a door inside Sea Mauville.

Key to Room 4.name: Key to Room 4
Key to Room 4.effect: A key that opens a door inside Sea Mauville.

Key to Room 6.name: Key to Room 6
Key to Room 6.effect: A key that opens a door inside Sea Mauville.

Kofu's Wallet.name: Kofu's Wallet
Kofu's Wallet.effect: A wallet that was left behind by Kofu, the Gym Leader at the Cascarrafa Gym. You're to deliver it to him at the market in Porto Marinada.

Koraidon's Poké Ball.name: Koraidon's Poké Ball
Koraidon's Poké Ball.effect: A Poké Ball that can hold the mysterious Pokémon known as Koraidon. A boy named Arven gave it to you.

Left Poké Ball.name: Left Poké Ball
Left Poké Ball.effect: A Poké Ball containing a Pokémon that lost its Trainer. It seems the Trainer hails from Ula'ula Island.

Legend Plate.name: Legend Plate
Legend Plate.effect: A stone tablet imbued with the essence of all creation. When used on a certain Pokémon, it allows that Pokémon to gain the power of every type there is.

Legendary Clue.name: Legendary Clue
Legendary Clue.effect: A mysterious clue that Peony seems to have dropped. There's a photo attached to it showing a shining hole opening above the Max Lair.

Legendary Clue 1.name: Legendary Clue 1
Legendary Clue 1.effect: A clue about the King of Bountiful Harvests. It's written by Peony, and an old photo is attached to it.

Legendary Clue 2.name: Legendary Clue 2
Legendary Clue 2.effect: A clue about the legend of giants. It's written by Peony and has unique drawings.

Legendary Clue 3.name: Legendary Clue 3
Legendary Clue 3.effect: A clue about the legend of bird Pokémon. It's written by Peony and has a unique drawing.

Lens Case.name: Lens Case
Lens Case.effect: A rather chic-looking case for carrying contact lenses.

Letter.name: Letter
Letter.effect: An extremely important letter to Steven from the President of Devon Corporation.

Lift Key.name: Lift Key
Lift Key.effect: A key that operates the elevator in TEAM ROCKET's HIDEOUT. It bears the TEAM ROCKET logo.

Light Stone.name: Light Stone
Light Stone.effect: Reshiram's body was destroyed and changed into this stone. It is said to be waiting for the emergence of a hero.

Looker Ticket.name: Looker Ticket
Looker Ticket.effect: A ticket that was handmade by Looker. It's decorated with a liberal amount of glittery paint.

Loot Sack.name: Loot Sack
Loot Sack.effect: A sturdy, spacious bag that is used to carry any treasures or loot obtained in the coal mine.

Lost Item.name: Lost Item
Lost Item.effect: The Mime Jr. doll that was lost by the Copycat.

Lunar Wing.name: Lunar Wing
Lunar Wing.effect: A feather that glows like the moon. It's said to possess the power to dispel nightmares.

Mach Bike.name: Mach Bike
Mach Bike.effect: This folding Bike more than doubles your movement speed.

Machine Part.name: Machine Part
Machine Part.effect: An important part of a machine that was stolen from the Power Plant.

Magma Emblem.name: Magma Emblem
Magma Emblem.effect: A medal-like item in the same shape as Team Magma's mark.

Magma Stone.name: Magma Stone
Magma Stone.effect: A stone formed by boulders melting in intensely hot magma, then hardening. Magma remains sealed inside it.

Magma Suit.name: Magma Suit
Magma Suit.effect: A suit made with the collective technological know-how of Team Magma. It can withstand any impact.

Mark Charm.name: Mark Charm
Mark Charm.effect: Having one of these mysterious and unique charms makes it more likely you'll encounter a Pokémon with a mark.

Medal Box.name: Medal Box
Medal Box.effect: A box-shaped machine that stores Medals and Medal information.

Mega Bracelet.name: Mega Bracelet
Mega Bracelet.effect: This bracelet contains an unknown power that somehow enables a Pokémon carrying a Mega Stone to Mega Evolve in battle.

Mega Ring.name: Mega Ring
Mega Ring.effect: This ring contains an unknown power that somehow enables a Pokémon carrying a Mega Stone to Mega Evolve in battle.

Mesprit's Plume.name: Mesprit's Plume
Mesprit's Plume.effect: Proof that you have completed the trial set by Mesprit, the Being of Emotion that lives in Lake Verity. This item is needed to forge the Red Chain.

Meteorite.name: Meteorite
Meteorite.effect: A Meteorite originally found at Meteor Falls. You got it at Mt. Chimney.

Meteorite Shard.name: Meteorite Shard
Meteorite Shard.effect: One of the fragments of a meteorite from Granite Cave. It's faintly warm to the touch.

Miraidon's Poké Ball.name: Miraidon's Poké Ball
Miraidon's Poké Ball.effect: A Poké Ball that can hold the mysterious Pokémon known as Miraidon. A boy named Arven gave it to you.

Moon Flute.name: Moon Flute
Moon Flute.effect: It is said that the tones it produces were offered up as an expression of gratitude to the Legendary Pokémon of the moon.

Mystery Egg.name: Mystery Egg
Mystery Egg.effect: An Egg obtained from Mr. Pokémon. It has a mysterious pattern on it, and what is in the Egg is unknown.

N-Lunarizer.name: N-Lunarizer
N-Lunarizer.effect: A machine to separate Necrozma, which needed light, from Lunala.

N-Solarizer.name: N-Solarizer
N-Solarizer.effect: A machine to separate Necrozma, which needed light, from Solgaleo.

Old Charm.name: Old Charm
Old Charm.effect: An ancient good-luck charm made of Pokémon bones to be taken to the elder of Celestic Town.

Old Journal.name: Old Journal
Old Journal.effect: A stab-bound journal that once had pages torn from it. All the pages have been collected and restored.

Old Letter.name: Old Letter
Old Letter.effect: A letter entrusted to you by a girl, to be delivered to a boy. Strangely, it looks old to you.

Old Rod.name: Old Rod
Old Rod.effect: An old and beat-up fishing rod. Use it at bodies of water to fish for Pokémon.

Orange Petal.name: Orange Petal
Orange Petal.effect: A pressed flower petal you receive from Ilima during Mina's trial. The goal is to collect seven different kinds of petals.

Origin Ore.name: Origin Ore
Origin Ore.effect: An ore of mysterious power, spoken of in ancient myths and said to contain the power of almighty Sinnoh itself.

Oval Charm.name: Oval Charm
Oval Charm.effect: Having one of these mysterious oval charms makes it more likely Pokémon Eggs might be found during picnics.

Pair of Tickets.name: Pair of Tickets
Pair of Tickets.effect: Tickets for two to the astronomical show being held at the Mossdeep Space Center.

Pal Pad.name: Pal Pad
Pal Pad.effect: A convenient notepad that is used to register your friends and keep a record of your gameplay.

Parcel.name: Parcel
Parcel.effect: A parcel entrusted into your care. You're supposed to deliver it to your childhood friend who left Twinleaf Town.

Pass.name: Pass
Pass.effect: A pass required for riding the Magnet Train. It allows you to ride whenever and however much you'd like.

Permit.name: Permit
Permit.effect: A permit that is needed to enter the Nature Preserve, a place that not many people know about.

Photo Album.name: Photo Album
Photo Album.effect: A nice photo album for storing all the photos taken along your adventure.

Picnic Set.name: Picnic Set
Picnic Set.effect: A roomy basket packed with all sorts of things for use when enjoying picnicking with your Pokémon.

Pink Petal.name: Pink Petal
Pink Petal.effect: A pressed flower petal you receive from Mina during Mina's trial. The goal is to collect seven different kinds of petals.

Plasma Card.name: Plasma Card
Plasma Card.effect: A card key needed to enter the password inside the Plasma Frigate.

Poffin Case.name: Poffin Case
Poffin Case.effect: A case for storing Poffins cooked from Berries.

Point Card.name: Point Card
Point Card.effect: A card that lists how many Battle Points you have earned.

Poké Radar.name: Poké Radar
Poké Radar.effect: A tool that can search out Pokémon that are hiding in the tall grass. Its battery is recharged as you walk.

PokéBlock.name: PokéBlock
PokéBlock.effect: Pokéblocks are used to prepare a Pokémon for contests by raising its condition in the appropriate category or categories.

PokéBlock Kit.name: PokéBlock Kit
PokéBlock Kit.effect: A set containing a Berry Blender for making Pokéblocks and a Pokéblock Case for storing Pokéblocks.

PokéBlock Case.name: PokéBlock Case
PokéBlock Case.effect: A case for holding POKéBLOCKS made with a BERRY BLENDER.

Poké Flute.name: Poké Flute
Poké Flute.effect: A flute that can play with such a beautiful tone that even sleeping Pokémon find themselves woken up.

Pokémon Box Link.name: Pokémon Box Link
Pokémon Box Link.effect: A device that allows you to access the Pokémon storage system. There are some places where it won't work.

Power Plant Pass.name: Power Plant Pass
Power Plant Pass.effect: This pass serves as an ID card for gaining access to the Power Plant that lies along Route 13.

Prison Bottle.name: Prison Bottle
Prison Bottle.effect: A bottle believed to have been used to seal away the power of a certain Pokémon long, long ago.

Prof's Letter.name: Prof's Letter
Prof's Letter.effect: A letter that Professor Sycamore wrote to your mother. A faint but pleasant perfume seems to cling to the paper.

Professor's Mask.name: Professor's Mask
Professor's Mask.effect: The mask that belongs to The Masked Royal. This pro wrestler apparently sews his mask on a machine himself.

Prop Case.name: Prop Case
Prop Case.effect: A wondrous, pretty case to store lots of colorful Props for your Pokémon to wear in a musical.

Purple Petal.name: Purple Petal
Purple Petal.effect: A pressed flower petal you receive from Nanu during Mina's trial. The goal is to collect seven different kinds of petals.

Radiant Petal.name: Radiant Petal
Radiant Petal.effect: A single petal that the King of Bountiful Harvests gave you. It radiates faint light.

Rainbow Flower.name: Rainbow Flower
Rainbow Flower.effect: A flower made of the petals you received from captains. It's proof that your growth has been recognized by them.

Rainbow Pass.name: Rainbow Pass
Rainbow Pass.effect: A pass for ferries between VERMILION and the SEVII ISLANDS. It features a drawing of a rainbow.

Rainbow Wing.name: Rainbow Wing
Rainbow Wing.effect: A strange feather that gleams in rainbow colors.

Red Chain.name: Red Chain
Red Chain.effect: A mythical chain that is said to bind the Legendary Pokémon that created the Sinnoh region.

Red Petal.name: Red Petal
Red Petal.effect: A pressed flower petal you receive from Kiawe during Mina's trial. The goal is to collect seven different kinds of petals.

Red Scale.name: Red Scale
Red Scale.effect: A scale from a red Gyarados that appeared at the Lake of Rage. It glows red like a flame.

Reins of Unity.name: Reins of Unity
Reins of Unity.effect: Reins that people presented to the king. They enable those who are connected to communicate with each other. The reins separate Calyrex and its beloved steed.

Reveal Glass.name: Reveal Glass
Reveal Glass.effect: A mysterious looking glass that reveals the truth. It can return a Pokémon to its original shape.

Ride Pager.name: Ride Pager
Ride Pager.effect: By entering certain numbers on this pager, you can summon Ride Pokémon in an instant.

Roller Skates.name: Roller Skates
Roller Skates.effect: Attaches roller skates to the bottom of your shoes, allowing you to glide quickly around and perform tricks.

Roto-Stick.name: Roto-Stick
Roto-Stick.effect: A stick to rest a Rotom Phone on. It allows you to take selfies from a little bit farther away than you could on your own.

Rotom Bike.name: Rotom Bike
Rotom Bike.effect: This bike can be combined with the Pokémon Rotom to not only do a turbo boost but also run on the water.

Rotom Catalog.name: Rotom Catalog
Rotom Catalog.effect: A catalog of devices that Rotom like. Use the catalog to have Rotom hop in and out of the various devices listed within.

Rotom Phone.name: Rotom Phone
Rotom Phone.effect: The latest model of smartphone. A Pokémon called Rotom lives within it, and it can be used to run all sorts of handy apps.

Rule Book.name: Rule Book
Rule Book.effect: It lists the rules for holding battles. For Link Battles, you may choose which set of rules you wish to use.

S.S. Ticket.name: S.S. Ticket
S.S. Ticket.effect: A ticket required for sailing on the high-speed ferry S.S. Aqua. It has a drawing of a ship on it.

Sandwich.name: Sandwich
Sandwich.effect: A dish made by sandwiching vegetables, meat, or other ingredients between two pieces of bread. It makes a fantastic meal when out on a picnic.

Scanner.name: Scanner
Scanner.effect: A device found inside Sea Mauville.

Scarlet Book.name: Scarlet Book
Scarlet Book.effect: A record of the expedition that the author, Heath, went on within the Great Crater of Paldea. The book has the name “Sada” written on it in clumsy handwriting.

Seal Bag.name: Seal Bag
Seal Bag.effect: A tiny bag that can hold 10 Stickers for decorating Ball Capsules.

Seal Case.name: Seal Case
Seal Case.effect: A case for storing Stickers that can be applied to Ball Capsules.

Secret Medicine.name: Secret Medicine
Secret Medicine.effect: An astonishing medicine that can instantly restore health to any Pokémon. It is produced by an apothecary in Cianwood City.

Secret Potion.name: SecretPotion
Secret Potion.effect: A fantastic medicine dispensed by the pharmacy in Cianwood City. It fully heals a Pokémon of any ailment.

Shaderoot Carrot.name: Shaderoot Carrot
Shaderoot Carrot.effect: Produce that the King of Bountiful Harvests' beloved steed likes to eat. It grew in a gloomy field.

Shiny Charm.name: Shiny Charm
Shiny Charm.effect: Having one of these mysterious shining charms makes it more likely you'll encounter Shiny Pokémon in the wild.

Silph Scope.name: Silph Scope
Silph Scope.effect: This item gives you the ability to see ghost Pokémon as their actual species and thus allow you to battle them. It is necessary to pass through the Pokémon Tower.

Silver Wing.name: Silver Wing
Silver Wing.effect: A strange feather that gleams with a silvery color.

Sonia's Book.name: Sonia's Book
Sonia's Book.effect: Professor Sonia's published writings. Her new discoveries about the Galar region's legends are recorded in this enjoyable read.

Soot Sack.name: Soot Sack
Soot Sack.effect: A sack used to gather and hold volcanic ash.

Sparkling Stone.name: Sparkling Stone
Sparkling Stone.effect: A stone entrusted to you by a Pokémon that has been venerated as a guardian deity in the Alola region. There is said to be some secret in how it sparkles.

Sprayduck.name: Sprayduck
Sprayduck.effect: A watering can shaped like a Psyduck. It helps promote the healthy growth of any Berries planted in good, soft soil.

Sprinklotad.name: Sprinklotad
Sprinklotad.effect: A watering can shaped like a Lotad. It helps promote the healthy growth of any Berries planted in good, soft soil.

Squirt Bottle.name: Squirt Bottle
Squirt Bottle.effect: A bottle used for watering plants in the Berry Pots.

Storage Key.name: Storage Key
Storage Key.effect: The key to Team Galactic's sinister warehouse located at the edge of Veilstone City.

Style Card.name: Style Card
Style Card.effect: Having one of these cards increases the selection available to you in boutiques and hair salons.

Suite Key.name: Suite Key
Suite Key.effect: A key to one of the suites at a certain luxury hotel by a lake. For some odd reason, it often disappears.

Sun Flute.name: Sun Flute
Sun Flute.effect: It is said that the tones it produces were offered up as an expression of gratitude to the Legendary Pokémon of the sun.

Super Rod.name: Super Rod
Super Rod.effect: An awesome, high-spec fishing rod. Use it at bodies of water to fish for Pokémon.

Surge Badge.name: Surge Badge
Surge Badge.effect: A novelty badge that you can receive at the Kantonian Gym. Rumor has it that it imitates the Badge of a Gym somewhere.

TM Case.name: TM Case
TM Case.effect: A case that holds TMs and HMs. It is attached to the BAG's compartment for important items.

TMV Pass.name: TMV Pass
TMV Pass.effect: A commuter pass that allows the holder to ride the TMV between Lumiose City and Kiloude City at any time.

Tea.name: Tea
Tea.effect: An aromatic tea prepared by an old lady. It will slake even the worst thirst.

Teal Mask.name: Teal Mask
Teal Mask.effect: A teal mask patterned after the face of an ogre. Ogerpon dropped it while fleeing up the stairs after visiting the Festival of Masks.

Teal Style Card.name: Teal Style Card
Teal Style Card.effect: Having one of these cards increases the selection available to you in boutiques and hair salons.

Tera Orb.name: Tera Orb
Tera Orb.effect: An orb that holds within it the power to crystallize. When it is charged with energy, it can be used to cause Pokémon to Terastallize.

Tidal Bell.name: Tidal Bell
Tidal Bell.effect: A very old-fashioned bell that makes a gentle ringing sound.

Torn Journal.name: Torn Journal
Torn Journal.effect: An old, stab-bound diary in a traditional style. It has been torn and is missing the latter half of its pages.

Town Map.name: Town Map
Town Map.effect: A very convenient map that can be viewed anytime. It even shows you your present location in the region.

Travel Trunk.name: Travel Trunk
Travel Trunk.effect: A light and yet incredibly effective trunk, which can contain every last piece of clothing that can be bought.

Tri-Pass.name: Tri-Pass
Tri-Pass.effect: A pass for ferries between ONE, TWO, and THREE ISLAND. It has a drawing of three islands.

Unown Report.name: Unown Report
Unown Report.effect: A report of all the discovered kinds of Unown.

Uxie's Claw.name: Uxie's Claw
Uxie's Claw.effect: Proof that you have completed the trial set by Uxie, the Being of Knowledge that lives in Lake Acuity. This item is needed to forge the Red Chain.

Violet Book.name: Violet Book
Violet Book.effect: A record of the expedition that the author, Heath, went on within the Great Crater of Paldea. The book has the name “Turo” written on it in clumsy handwriting.

Vs. Recorder.name: Vs. Recorder
Vs. Recorder.effect: An amazing device that can record a battle between friends or the battles at certain special battle facilities.

Vs. Seeker.name: Vs. Seeker
Vs. Seeker.effect: A device that indicates Trainers who want to battle. Its battery charges while you walk.

Wailmer Pail.name: Wailmer Pail
Wailmer Pail.effect: This is a tool for watering Berries you planted to make them grow more quickly.

Wall Fragment.name: Wall Fragment
Wall Fragment.effect: A fragment that was once part of a stone panel in the Solaceon Ruins. It has markings carved on it that appear to be some kind of writing.

White Mane Hair.name: White Mane Hair
White Mane Hair.effect: Mane hair that belonged to the King of Bountiful Harvests' beloved steed, Glastrier. The hair is strong and very flexible.

Wishing Star.name: Wishing Star
Wishing Star.effect: A stone found in the Galar region with a mysterious power. It's said that your dreams come true if you find one.

Wooden Crown.name: Wooden Crown
Wooden Crown.effect: A mysterious object made of wood. Part of it seems to be chipped. Maybe it's meant to be part of something.

Works Key.name: Works Key
Works Key.effect: A large key for operating the doors of the Valley Windworks in the canyon. It was held by a Team Galactic Grunt.

Xtransceiver.name: Xtransceiver
Xtransceiver.effect: A high-tech transceiver with a camera function. It allows up to four-way calls.

Yellow Petal.name: Yellow Petal
Yellow Petal.effect: A pressed flower petal you receive from Sophocles during Mina's trial. The goal is to collect seven different kinds of petals.

Z-Power Ring.name: Z-Power Ring
Z-Power Ring.effect: A mysterious ring that enables Pokémon to use Z-Power. It requires both the willpower and the physical power of the Trainer wearing it.

Z-Ring.name: Z-Ring
Z-Ring.effect: A mysterious ring that enables Pokémon to use Z-Power. It requires both the willpower and the physical power of the Trainer wearing it.

Zygarde Cube.name: Zygarde Cube
Zygarde Cube.effect: An item in which Zygarde Cores and Cells are gathered. You can also use it to change Zygarde's forms.

Swampertite.name: Swampertite
Swampertite.effect: It is the Mega Stone that allows Swampert to Mega Evolve into Mega Swampert.

Time Gear.name: Time Gear
Time Gear.effect: The Time Gears help keep control of the flow of time in the Pokémon world.
